name: BridgeU
slogan: Intelligent Higher Ed & Early Careers Preparation
description:
Bridging the gap between school and the future. BridgeU was founded to help young people around the world realise their potential, through empowering schools to provide smart, modern university and careers guidance. Features include Document Sending, Reference Writing, Admissions Insights, Smart University Matching, Career Planning, International Destinations, Performance Insights, and Results Showcasing. Our platform manages the complex challenge of preparing and carrying out university applications, using data, intelligent tools, and streamlined task management, helping schools to prepare the students of today for the world of tomorrow.

Declared one of the most innovative EdTech Startups in Europe (by EdTech Europe), BridgeU has raised £6.4m in venture capital from Octopus Investments, Seedcamp, Fresco Capital & Deborah Quazzo.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative (HK Office)
jobs.description:
At BridgeU, we make educational decisions data-driven through predictive analytics, and we use machine learning to better prepare students for the next stage of their educational and professional journeys. One of the top 20 Startups in Europe (by EdTech Europe), and having recently closed a large investment round ($3.5m) from top global investors, BridgeU is one of the most innovative, fast-growing Education Technology businesses in Europe.
 
About the Role: 

As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will join our business development team that is responsible for building and capitalizing on relationships with secondary schools, global education companies, governments, and universities from around the world. You will research and identify target customers within our market and ideal customer profile. You will create targeted, personalized, outbound campaigns to reach new prospects, and will manage inbound leads as the first point of contact. The most important measure of success will be qualified meetings booked. We’re looking for someone who is not phone-shy, takes ownership of their targets and finds inventive ways to contribute to growing the business. 

You'll be joining a smart, ambitious team, in an exciting, fast-growth environment. You will be an early hire into the new Hong Kong office and will have the opportunity to work closely with senior management, and influence how we continue to develop this part of our organization. 

The successful candidate will be:

* Smart, ambitious and motivated by reaching and exceeding new business targets.
* Focused, details-oriented and adaptable.
* Curious and ready to learn and fully absorb the climate and concerns of the education technology industry.
* A strong communicator and effective team-player

Requirements:

- (Preferred) 12+ months experience as a top performing SDR using a mixture of email, social media and phone 
- A demonstrable passion for technology and the startup community 
- Excellent relationship and communication skills
- Ability to sell a compelling vision of a technology platform that’s changing the way in which students plan their futures

Compensation details:

Monthly Salary (HKD): $17-$21k
Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Base salary will depend on prior experience.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager (Hong Kong)
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our Customer Success team in Hong Kong to build and manage powerful customer relationships in our APAC schools. As a fast growth, customer-focused business, we are investing in passionate, smart and dedicated individuals to help ensure that our customers get the care and support they need to be active advocates of the BridgeU platform. 

Specifically, you will help school guidance and careers counsellors to make best use of the BridgeU platform, understand their unique challenges and work with them and our product team to ensure we provide the best possible service. You will work with senior stakeholders in schools to manage the process of changing from manual/ alternative technologies to BridgeU and ensure schools fully leverage the potential of the platform they have purchased to meet their specific needs. 

If you're curious about global education, if you love working with customers, if you're inspired by Education Technology, if you've thrived in Customer Success roles before and want to bring your expertise to a fast-growth startup environment, then we want to hear from you!

This is a great opportunity for an empathetic, emotionally intelligent and curious person who cares about helping our customers to have the best experience possible. 

Responsibilities
- Manage post-training relationships for BridgeU's schools through strong relationship-building, analysis of platform usage, product knowledge, and product feedback. 
- Maintain a deep understanding of the product and consult with customers about relevant features for their needs.
- Input and execute on plans with each customer for feature-launches, renewals and up-sells.
- Contribute to our customer retention goals and customer satisfaction targets by tracking each school account to identify churn risk, and working to eliminate that risk and delight every user.
- Work closely with our product development team to identify and track customer feature requests, user-experience improvements and bugs.
- Function as a voice of the customer, providing internal feedback on how BridgeU can better serve our global school network.

Requirements
- Keenness to develop great relationships with all our customers, along with a deep desire to help people and to take a "customer first" approach
- Outstanding communication skills with everyone from stressed teachers to School Group CEOs.
- A passion for global higher education, customer success and educational outcomes through technology.
- Being tech savvy and a quick learner of new technologies
- Eligibility to work in Hong Kong
- At least 2 years (preferably 3-5) relevant work experience in an Account Management or Customer Success (or similar) position
- Account Management/Customer Success experience in SaaS startup a plus

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative (London)
jobs.description:
At BridgeU, we make educational decisions data-driven through predictive analytics, and we use machine learning to better prepare students for the next stage of their educational and professional journeys. One of the top 20 Startups in Europe (by EdTech Europe), and having closed a large investment round ($3.5m) from top global investors, BridgeU is one of the most innovative, fast-growing Education Technology businesses in Europe. 
 
What you’ll be doing: 

As a Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will play a crucial role in demand generation for the sales team, who are responsible for building and capitalizing on relationships with secondary schools, global education companies, governments, and universities from around the world. You will research and identify target customers within our market and ideal customer profile. 

You will report to the Senior Marketing Manager and will create targeted, personalized, outbound campaigns to reach new prospects, and will manage inbound leads as the first point of contact. The most important measure of success will be qualified meetings booked. We’re looking for someone who is not phone-shy, takes ownership of their targets and finds inventive ways to contribute to growing the business. 

You'll be joining a smart, ambitious team, in an exciting, fast-growth environment. You will be a key hire in London and will have the opportunity to work closely with senior management, and influence how we continue to develop this part of our organisation. 

What you’ll bring: 

*You’re smart, ambitious and motivated by reaching and exceeding new business targets.
*You’re focused, detail-oriented and adaptable.
*You’re curious and ready to learn and fully absorb the climate and concerns of the education technology industry.
*You’re a strong communicator and effective team-player, and you are resilient in times of change
*You’re excited about the global education problem we’re trying to solve, and at the thought of making a big impact on the business 
*You might speak other languages (particularly Spanish, French, Arabic) 
*You have the ability to sell a compelling vision of a technology platform that’s changing the way in which students plan their futures
*6+ months experience as a top performing SDR using a mixture of email, social media and phone is a nice-to-have, but we do provide training, so if you’re an ambitious graduate looking for your first role and you’re interested in EdTech, we still want to hear from you 


What we’ll provide

*Competitive salary - £22k - £25k base salary depending on experience, up to £30k OTE in year 1 
*Opportunities for flexible and remote working hours, encouraging everyone to have a healthy work-life balance 
*Annual offsite: we organise a retreat once a year where the whole company gets together 
*Regular socials and early finish Fridays once a month 
*Personal development: books, courses and conferences that can help you learn and grow 
*A comfortable office in Angel stocked with fruit, tea/coffee, snacks, ice creams and a drinks fridge 
*Career progression and development 
*Private health insurance (upon completion of probation) 
*Employer’s pension scheme 
*An open and democratic work culture where everyone can contribute, learn and teach


Equal Opportunities 
We are a global team with a global mindset, cherishing and protecting diversity as one of our core values. We are always looking to diversify the talent in our team. 

Applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion, belief, marriage or civil partnership. If you feel you don’t quite meet all the criteria in the job spec but have the potential to do the role, we’d still love to hear from you.

The BD team is our engine room for the company’s growth, and you will do this by developing good relationships with potential customers and helping them to see the value our product can bring them. 

You will report to the Head of School Sales and will develop relationships with customers globally, helping them to understand our product and mission and the value we can provide them. We’re looking for someone who is not phone-shy, takes ownership of their targets and finds inventive ways to contribute to growing the business.

- You have the ability to sell a compelling vision of a technology platform that’s changing the way in which students plan their futures
